name: Game Mechanics Knowledge
title: Game Mechanics Knowledge
description: Detailed mechanics, rules, and variations for workshop games
philosophy: Games are not icebreakers or time-fillers. They are precision instruments for unlocking insight, building trust, and generating artifacts through play.

game_design_principles.purpose_clarity: Every game has a clear outcome it generates
game_design_principles.psychological_safety: Games should feel safe to fail at
game_design_principles.fun_is_functional: Joy unlocks creativity and builds bonds

future_headlines.setup_script: Imagine it's 5 years from now. Your project has succeeded beyond wildest dreams. Major publications are writing about it. You'll write newspaper headlines about this success.
future_headlines.scoring: 3 votes per person, vote for inspiration not feasibility
synthesis_questions: What emotions do the best headlines evoke?

variations.magazine_cover: Design full magazine cover with subheadlines
variations.future_interview: Write interview quotes from future selves

stakeholder_safari.setup_script: We're going on a safari to discover who we're serving. First, brainstorm all stakeholders. Then each person will become a stakeholder and be interviewed in character.
interview_prompts: What's your name and what's your daily life like?
What keeps you up at night regarding [topic]?
If this project succeeds, how is your Tuesday different?
What would make you trust a new solution?
What's the thing no one asks about but matters to you?
synthesis_questions: What surprised us about a stakeholder?

dilemma_duel.core_mechanic: Structured ethical debate with values extraction
dilemma_duel.setup_script: You'll face ethical dilemmas with no perfect answer. Split into teams to debate. The goal isn't winning - it's discovering your values.
values_extraction_prompts: What value was each side protecting?
What principle could honor both concerns?
How might this dilemma appear in our project?

dilemma_templates.template: You can do X quickly with some risk or Y slowly with certainty
Full disclosure benefits group but exposes individual
Users want control but might harm themselves

value_auction.setup_script: You each have 100 points - your total investment capacity. We'll auction values. You cannot get more points. This reveals what you truly prioritize.

auction_mechanics.winner_explanation: Winner explains why this value was worth the price

analysis_prompts: Which values sold highest? What does that reveal?
Where did stated preferences differ from bidding behavior?

tradeoff_tetris.setup_script: List all your constraints: time, budget, skills, dependencies, quality. Size blocks by weight. Now fit them all in your capacity container. Some won't fit - that's the trade-off.
negotiation_prompts: What could we shrink? What would we lose?
Can we expand the container? At what cost?

agent_trading_cards.core_mechanic: Character design with stats and lore
materials: Art supplies or AI image generation
agent_trading_cards.setup_script: We're creating a trading card for each agent. Think of them as characters with personalities, abilities, and weaknesses. Make them memorable!

skill_bingo.setup_script: Fill your bingo card with skills your project needs. Mix obvious ones with creative ideas. First to complete a pattern wins!

bingo_rules.call_requirement: Must explain why project needs this skill to mark it

architecture_pictionary.setup_script: Draw system concepts while others guess. No words allowed! See how different people visualize the same thing.
architecture_pictionary.synthesis_focus: Where did mental models align vs. diverge?

gratitude_circle.setup_script: Think of one specific moment when someone on this team helped, taught, or inspired you. We'll share our gratitude around the circle.

for_small_teams.general: Everyone participates in everything, deeper discussions
for_small_teams.future_headlines: More headlines per person, fuller discussion
for_small_teams.dilemma_duel: No team split, assign devil's advocate

for_medium_teams.general: Split for games, combine for synthesis

for_large_teams.future_headlines: Async submission, group curation, rep presentation

purpose_driven_game_selection.name: Purpose-Driven Game Selection
purpose_driven_game_selection.description: Select games based on desired outcome (vision, ethics, technology, design, celebration) rather than entertainment value
purpose_driven_game_selection.usage: Identify workshop goal first, then select games from appropriate category (creative, strategic, collaborative) that generate needed artifacts

scaling_mechanics.name: Team Size Adaptation
scaling_mechanics.description: Adapt game mechanics to team size - small teams do everything together, large teams use parallel tracks and representatives
scaling_mechanics.usage: For small teams (2-5): deeper participation. Medium (6-12): split and combine. Large (13+): parallel games with synthesis

energy_matching.name: Energy-Aware Game Selection
energy_matching.description: Match game energy requirements to team's current state - use low-energy games when team is tired, high-energy when energized
energy_matching.usage: Check team energy at start, select games from appropriate category (low-energy: gallery walk, gratitude circle; high-energy: dilemma duel, value auction)

psychological_safety_first.name: Safety Before Play
psychological_safety_first.description: Ensure psychological safety is established before games begin - games require risk-taking and vulnerability to be effective
psychological_safety_first.usage: Ground in Axiom 0, establish safety norms, model vulnerability, then introduce games that build on that foundation

anti_patterns.name: Games as Time Fillers
anti_patterns.problem: Using games as entertainment or icebreakers without clear purpose wastes time and reduces participant engagement
anti_patterns.solution: Every game must have clear outcome - select games that generate specific artifacts (headlines, values, constraints) aligned with workshop goals

anti_patterns.name: Skipping Synthesis
anti_patterns.problem: Ending games without extracting insights wastes the creative output and fails to translate play into actionable outcomes
anti_patterns.solution: Always allocate synthesis time after games - use structured questions to identify themes, patterns, and next steps from game outcomes

anti_patterns.name: One-Size-Fits-All Scaling
anti_patterns.problem: Using same game format for 3-person and 30-person teams leads to either overwhelming small teams or excluding voices in large teams
anti_patterns.solution: Adapt mechanics to team size - small teams do everything together, large teams use parallel tracks, representatives, and async components

anti_patterns.name: Ignoring Team Energy
anti_patterns.problem: Forcing high-energy games when team is exhausted, or low-energy games when team is energized, wastes potential and frustrates participants
anti_patterns.solution: Check team energy at start, select games from appropriate category, use energy boosters or calming techniques as needed

anti_patterns.name: Games Without Safety
anti_patterns.problem: Launching games that require vulnerability without establishing psychological safety prevents honest participation and creative output
anti_patterns.solution: Always ground in Axiom 0 first, establish safety norms, model vulnerability, then introduce games that build on that foundation
